name: The Exchange Restaurant at Hilton Liverpool City Centre
openingHours:
Monday -
Tuesday -
Wednesday -
Thursday -

Saturday -

reviewList/0/review: We had afternoon tea for a hen night, it was really nice
reviewList/1/review: Had to wait 40 minutes for drinks to be brought over , when food came burgers looked like they were warmed up from the day before , afternoon tea one of the sandwiches the bread was hard like it had been sitting out for a long time . All in all very disappointing and total waste of a lot of money
reviewList/2/review: The staff service was good, but abit disappointed that i had said when booking stick to simple sandwiches, as fussy eater, was nit asked if i have any allergies, i think you should label sandwiches as my sister who i was with checked for fish ones as have an allergies to fish. Cakes and savoury were good, would of expected more for what was paid for.
reviewList/3/review:
Lovely attentive staff,  fresh sandwiches and cakes with a nice selection of all. We were sat in front of a giant TV screen (fortunately with volume down) but it felt a bit empty and out on a limb. Maybe a booth might have been 
 maybe they were all full. 
£29.95 for afternoon tea with prosecco. Averagely priced for city centre but still overpriced for what you actually get per person
reviewList/4/review: I had high expectations of the Hilton and it didn’t disappoint. Afternoon tea for a friend’s birthday celebration, food was devine and more than enough. The way the booths are situated is brilliant, you’re not overlooked by any of the other guests, so comfortable. Really nice, pleasant staff, attentive but not too much. Would definitely go back to the Hilton again
reviewList/5/review: We had gone for afternoon tea and felt like everything had been sitting our for hours..stale bread and dried out filling..only 2 of the cakes were fresh..never again..for the money you pay there are so many more nicer fresher places..toilets were absolutely filthy...teenagers from the streets in the toilets and leaving it a disgrace but manager not too bothered when told
reviewList/6/review: Really good afternoon tea. Good selection of sandwiches and cakes and of course good tea. Ambience was very welcoming. Service was good. Would definitely visit again
reviewList/7/review: I booked the afternoon tea at the Hilton expecting the standard of food and service to be good. We had to wait a while before we were attended to. The sandwiches weren't the best as they had added mustard and Branston pickle to quite a few of them. We did complain and they brought us a few plain sandwiches. Sent my scone back as it was stale, they did replace it. Overall not the best afternoon tea, wouldn't go there again.
reviewList/8/review: We wanted afternoon tea and the Hilton was recommended to us by others.  The food was really good but it would have been nice if the wait staff and checked in with us at least once during our 1/2 hour or had informed of us of the time frame when serving us our tea/drinks. The booth we had was interesting, round & sort of private, but not totally comfortable.  I would go again.
reviewList/9/review: Great service ! Helen was great lovely food too
reviewList/10/review: can’t even put into words how angry i am at the service my mum and nan was treated by the staff here, they always go here and i always book for them the same thing every time and never been a problem well this time the lady was asking for a voucher i have never been sent a voucher to show always given there name in got afternoon tea the traditional one £19. today they tried charging them £22.50 per person. safe to say we will never be going back again after a year of our custom
reviewList/11/review: We had a lovely afternoon, great service from Jack. Very relaxed atmosphere, we stayed nearly four hours.  Good food, plenty of tea, good cocktails.
reviewList/12/review: Great place for our afternoon tea. Food was lovely and Jack who served us was an absolute amazing, he was so friendly.
reviewList/13/review: The staff were excellent & very helpful about everything. The cocktail's we're great too. We all really enjoyed the day & would come back again
reviewList/15/review: It was a lovely afternoon tea really enjoyed it many thanks we will be back very soon .  Can’t wait to come back next year for another birthday celebration
reviewList/16/review: I didn't think the afternoon tea was worth the money at all 22.95 per person when I booked it says there was a 16 pounds deal for afternoon Tea so we were disappointed also they cramped 4 off us on to a booth table and let us look at the menu for 5 seconds my partner and son had pizza instead and they didn't move the tea cups or side plates away we had to ask. Very slow and now what you would expect from the hilton. I love the hilton but this experience wasn't good at all.
reviewList/17/review: After calling the day previously and paying for afternoon tea my god mother & grandmother arrived as I do not live in liverpool this was a gift. They were advised that it is impossible to pay over the phone and they would need to pay the £45 for afternoon tea. Luckily my god mother called me and I was able to speak to someone who advised “I’m not sure what to do I’ll just put it through as complimentary” however it’s not complimentary when i have already paid the money! It ruined the experience for them and put my already unwell grandmother under great stress.
reviewList/18/review:
Some sandwiches really dry and a lot more bun than filling.  Ok value for the price but would not recommend to a friend.
A
reviewList/19/review: I booked this afternoon tea for my mum as a present to cheer her up after an unexpected family bereavement. She asked for no butter due to having an allergy they said that was fine but proceeded to bring out buttered bread. They brought out two glasses of Prosecco, as my mum doesn’t drink Prosecco she asked for a cup of tea, she never received a cup of tea.

name: Red Dog Saloon Liverpool
reviewList/0/review: Food was lovely and will defo be returning  ordered a little to much and they boxed it up for us. Great night
reviewList/1/review: We loved the red dog saloon it is a fantastic little place full of amazing food and cheery faces and has great music. I highly recommend Red Dog Saloon!
reviewList/2/review:
Amazing food here
Staff very friendly and helpful 
Definitely be back
reviewList/3/review: Food was nice but really overpriced ordering a burger and then fries as a extra really drives up the price. A small tub of mash with 3 bits of burnt ends for 7.50 is expensive
reviewList/4/review: Food is really good. We will definitely comeback ❤️
reviewList/5/review: The food on photos and reviews look really good however, the food I ordered was completely different it didn’t look like it was cooked the best and the taste was similar to follow, however my parter loved her medium burger and service started rocky but became a lot better as the night went on
reviewList/6/review: We was recommended by a friend & was very happy he did, food was gorgeous, staff very helpful, one little snag , was over charged but soon rectified ..
reviewList/7/review: My favourite place. My partner and I go often and tonight we took my dad for bottomless wings. Jay was wonderful as always and is our favourite server in the whole world
reviewList/8/review: We had a fabulous night here! The atmosphere was perfect, the staff were lovely and the food was delicious! Would definitely recommend, great experience!
reviewList/9/review: The food was ok and I’d even say the chicken tenders were nicer than the burgers! The ambience was loud and feisty, lots of youngster about and not exactly a family-friendly place for a Saturday night. Music was repetitive and more suited for a club than a restaurant. The toilets (especially for my boys) were a state given the young (drinking) people about. Service was very busy and difficult to get hold of but helpful once we got their attention. I didn’t get what the hype was all about with this place.
reviewList/10/review: Excellent service! Great food. Altogether lovely evening.
reviewList/11/review: Very tasty burger, attentive staff and nice atmosphere
reviewList/12/review: Tipico american restaurant , qualità ottima e atmosfera piacevole
reviewList/13/review:
I really wanted to like Red Dog, but it was only average... and in a market crowded with BBQ restaurants, average really doesn't cut it.

Service was a bit lacking - our server needed to check (or be reminded) of everything we ordered - not in a breezy "hey, let me check I got all that for ya!" kinda way, but just more "sorry, I wasn't really listening - did you say xxx?".

We ordered pulled pork, and it had to go back as it was nowhere near warm enough - like every good Brit, I *never* send food back, but this was barely tepid when it arrived. Our brisket (and the replacement pork) were the perfect temperature, but they both tasted overly peppery - there was none of that delicious lip-licking juicy flavour, just dry and slightly hot black pepper aftertaste.

The pit beans were average too - they just tasted like baked  beans with shredded sliced beef mixed in. I know that's fundamentally what pit beans are, but the PBs at Red's have never been anything other than stunning.

The food was OK, and the cocktails we had were absolutely stellar, but for close to £60 (food only), we were pretty unimpressed.
reviewList/14/review:
Friendly staff and amazing food, cooked to perfection. 
Home of the American staples. 10/10 will be back very soon to enjoy more of that “melt-in-your-mouth” brisket!
reviewList/15/review: Staff were friendly and welcoming . Restaurant clean and tidy. Food was tasty but bit salty, and over priced £12.50 for chicken burger than extra for fries don't know why they don't just charge £15 and its a meal.
reviewList/16/review:
The food was good enough but the service was horrendous. The staff were generally unfriendly and unhelpful, it took over 30 minutes for our drinks to arrive and numerous items ordered were forgotten by the staff and after pointing this out, there was no resolution other than to accept a refund for these items. 

In general as customers we felt ignored and not well looked after.
reviewList/18/review:
Burgers and sides were great! 
Brisket sandwiches a bit disappointing. 
Service was really good with helpful and friendly staff.
reviewList/19/review: Everything was great but that burnt end mash was something else mmmmm definitely be returning

name: Browns Brasserie & Bar - Liverpool
reviewList/1/review:
Lots of choices not available (lamb, venison special and cod!!!).
Ordered the 12 oz sirloin, got the 7oz fillet.
Ate it and left as service was chaotic.
reviewList/2/review: Please save your money and go somewhere else
reviewList/3/review: My husband and I have had a great time at Browns Liverpool. The food was amazing, would definitely recommend.
reviewList/4/review: It was the first time we had been to Brown's and we will definitely be coming again. The food was delicious, lots of healthy choices and the service was very good.
reviewList/5/review:
This visit was a birthday celebration for my husband, and we couldn’t have asked for more 
Service, food, seating was 100%
We have booked for another birthday celebration in June and I’m hoping that it will be the same :)
reviewList/6/review: Excellent Sunday Roast in a very nice relaxed atmosphere. Nice cocktails and great service. Would highly recommend
reviewList/8/review: Our 1st visit to Brown's Brasserie and we were delighted with both the food and the service.  Our waiter, Gary, was very friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Would definitely return.
reviewList/9/review: Cod was undercooked but rectified and was given good service and apology didn’t have to pay for main in true end .good service  polite staff thanks
reviewList/10/review: First time at Browns. Fantastic meal with quality good and excellent service from Gary and team. Thank you.
reviewList/11/review: Excellent food and service, as usual. Thank you ????
reviewList/12/review: Great food, friendly staff, good location
reviewList/13/review:
Food was excellent bathroom's not so much.

Floor needs repair and toilet roll re-stocking more regularly
reviewList/14/review:
Súper caro y lamentable. Nos cobraron 62 euros por algo que en España hubiese valido 25. No lo recomiendo a ningún español. Por primera vez en mi vida me planteé hacer un sinpa.
MENUDO ROBO Y ATRACO AL BOLSILLO.
reviewList/17/review:
Had a lovely meal. The restaurant was comfortable and warm. The service was exceptional..
Cost of food and drinks good value
reviewList/18/review: An excellent restaurant with fantastic food with a wide variety and choice of both food and drinks  Staff are very friendly and go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your experience
reviewList/19/review: Staff were very welcoming and ttentive once ta the table. Very good with children. Oy downside, the kids menu choice of sausage and mash - the sausages were too 'herby'
